intro: Randia annulata, commonly known as the ringed randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a distinctive veining pattern. Randia annulata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
